to have a short sleep: Thomas Edison was famous for his ability to catnap anywhere. He was tired in the day and would catnap and then be more wakeful at night. See also
nap verb
More examplesFewer examplesHe catnapped just before dawn and rose to the alarm at seven. She catnapped, shaking herself awake every time she felt herself drifting towards a deeper sleep.Try and catnap when the baby sleeps, or even just lie in front of the TV for a bit.
